trans-unit.source: Password box

trans-unit.source: A password box is a text input box that conceals the characters typed into it for the purpose of privacy.
trans-unit.target: A password box is a text input box that conceals the characters typed into it for the purpose of privacy.

trans-unit.source: A password box looks like a text box, except that it renders placeholder characters in place of the text that has been entered.
trans-unit.target: A password box looks like a text box, except that it renders placeholder characters in place of the text that has been entered.

trans-unit.source: You can configure the placeholder character.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the placeholder character.

trans-unit.source: By default, the password box provides a way for the user to view their password by holding down a reveal button.
trans-unit.target: By default, the password box provides a way for the user to view their password by holding down a reveal button.

trans-unit.source: You can disable the reveal button, or provide an alternate mechanism to reveal the password, such as a check box.
trans-unit.target: You can disable the reveal button, or provide an alternate mechanism to reveal the password, such as a check box.

trans-unit.source: Peek mode
trans-unit.target: Peek mode

trans-unit.source: By default, the password reveal button (or "peek" button) is shown.
trans-unit.target: By default, the password reveal button (or "peek" button) is shown.

trans-unit.source: The user must continuously press the button to view the password, so that a high level of security is maintained.
trans-unit.target: The user must continuously press the button to view the password, so that a high level of security is maintained.

trans-unit.source: The value of the [PasswordRevealMode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.passwordbox.passwordrevealmode.aspx) property is not the only factor that determines whether a password reveal button is visible to the user.
trans-unit.target: The value of the [PasswordRevealMode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.passwordbox.passwordrevealmode.aspx) property is not the only factor that determines whether a password reveal button is visible to the user.

trans-unit.source: Other factors include whether the control is displayed above a minimum width, whether the PasswordBox has focus, and whether the text entry field contains at least one character.
trans-unit.target: Other factors include whether the control is displayed above a minimum width, whether the PasswordBox has focus, and whether the text entry field contains at least one character.

trans-unit.source: The password reveal button is shown only when the PasswordBox receives focus for the first time and a character is entered.
trans-unit.target: The password reveal button is shown only when the PasswordBox receives focus for the first time and a character is entered.

trans-unit.source: If the PasswordBox loses focus and then regains focus, the reveal button is not shown again unless the password is cleared and character entry starts over.
trans-unit.target: If the PasswordBox loses focus and then regains focus, the reveal button is not shown again unless the password is cleared and character entry starts over.

trans-unit.source: **Caution**  Prior to Windows 10, the password reveal button was not shown by default.
trans-unit.target: **Caution**  Prior to Windows 10, the password reveal button was not shown by default.

trans-unit.source: If the security of your app requires that the password is always obscured, be sure to set PasswordRevealMode to Hidden.
trans-unit.target: If the security of your app requires that the password is always obscured, be sure to set PasswordRevealMode to Hidden.

trans-unit.source: Hidden and Visible modes
trans-unit.target: Hidden and Visible modes

trans-unit.source: The other [PasswordRevealMode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.passwordrevealmode.aspx) enumeration values, **Hidden** and **Visible**, hide the password reveal button and let you programmatically manage whether the password is obscured.
trans-unit.target: The other [PasswordRevealMode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.passwordrevealmode.aspx) enumeration values, **Hidden** and **Visible**, hide the password reveal button and let you programmatically manage whether the password is obscured.

trans-unit.source: To always obscure the password, set PasswordRevealMode to Hidden.
trans-unit.target: To always obscure the password, set PasswordRevealMode to Hidden.

trans-unit.source: Unless you need the password to be always obscured, you can provide a custom UI to let the user toggle the PasswordRevealMode between Hidden and Visible.
trans-unit.target: Unless you need the password to be always obscured, you can provide a custom UI to let the user toggle the PasswordRevealMode between Hidden and Visible.

trans-unit.source: In previous versions of Windows Phone, PasswordBox used a check box to toggle whether the password was obscured.
trans-unit.target: In previous versions of Windows Phone, PasswordBox used a check box to toggle whether the password was obscured.

trans-unit.source: Choose the right keyboard for your text control
trans-unit.target: Choose the right keyboard for your text control

trans-unit.source: To help users to enter data using the touch keyboard, or Soft Input Panel (SIP), you can set the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data the user is expected to enter.
trans-unit.target: To help users to enter data using the touch keyboard, or Soft Input Panel (SIP), you can set the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data the user is expected to enter.

trans-unit.source: PasswordBox supports only the **Password** and **NumericPin** input scope values.
trans-unit.target: PasswordBox supports only the **Password** and **NumericPin** input scope values.

trans-unit.source: Any other value is ignored.
trans-unit.target: Any other value is ignored.

trans-unit.source: For more info about how to use input scopes, see [Use input scope to change the touch keyboard]().

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: Use a label or placeholder text if the purpose of the password box isn't clear.
trans-unit.target: Use a label or placeholder text if the purpose of the password box isn't clear.

trans-unit.source: A label is visible whether or not the text input box has a value.
trans-unit.target: A label is visible whether or not the text input box has a value.

trans-unit.source: Placeholder text is displayed inside the text input box and disappears once a value has been entered.
trans-unit.target: Placeholder text is displayed inside the text input box and disappears once a value has been entered.

trans-unit.source: Give the password box an appropriate width for the range of values that can be entered.
trans-unit.target: Give the password box an appropriate width for the range of values that can be entered.

trans-unit.source: Word length varies between languages, so take localization into account if you want your app to be world-ready.
trans-unit.target: Word length varies between languages, so take localization into account if you want your app to be world-ready.

trans-unit.source: Don't put another control right next to a password input box.
trans-unit.target: Don't put another control right next to a password input box.

trans-unit.source: The password box has a password reveal button for users to verify the passwords they have typed, and having another control right next to it might make users accidentally reveal their passwords when they try to interact with the other control.
trans-unit.target: The password box has a password reveal button for users to verify the passwords they have typed, and having another control right next to it might make users accidentally reveal their passwords when they try to interact with the other control.

trans-unit.source: To prevent this from happening, put some spacing between the password in put box and the other control, or put the other control on the next line.
trans-unit.target: To prevent this from happening, put some spacing between the password in put box and the other control, or put the other control on the next line.

trans-unit.source: Consider presenting two password boxes for account creation: one for the new password, and a second to confirm the new password.
trans-unit.target: Consider presenting two password boxes for account creation: one for the new password, and a second to confirm the new password.

trans-unit.source: Only show a single password box for logins.
trans-unit.target: Only show a single password box for logins.

trans-unit.source: When a password box is used to enter a PIN, consider providing an instant response as soon as the last number is entered instead of using a confirmation button.
trans-unit.target: When a password box is used to enter a PIN, consider providing an instant response as soon as the last number is entered instead of using a confirmation button.
